text: Best corndogs ever! Especially love the cheesedogs. Do yourself a favor and follow them on social media to find out where they are so you can try them out! Trust me, you'll be obsessed

WBC truck ended up around the corner from me off Aliante Parkway and Grand Teton. Between my wife mentioning it to me and my barber talking about it one day I figured what the hell. I do not  like corn dogs specifically but trying these corn dogs have given me a new appreciation for them. Delicious!!! The regular corn dog my son got was ok but the the brat dogg is pure awesomeness. The maple brown sugar pineapple dipping sauce is perfect. Definitely a must try, only con is it is a bit pricey but the things are HUGE. I was one of the first in line but it does take awhile to make but the taste completely justifies the wait. TRY IT TRY IT NOW#!!!
These really are the best tasting corndogs! Their prices are fair and the corndogs are huge! Also there's a variety of sauces. They drive all over the valley

There's nothing quite like a fresh made corndog at the fair...unless there isn't a fair and you're at World's Best Corndogs!!! The truck travels all around the valley and they serve the BEST corndogs I have EVER HAD, hands down! We look forward to Wednesday, the day they're near our house, but to be honest we have driven across town to get one just to fulfill a craving. Great prices for an amazing corndog, and they are HUGE so come hungry!!!

Huge corndogs! The guys running it are genuinely nice and are obviously invested. Dogs were a tad on the greasy side, but not enough to keep us from finding these guys and going for more! Maybe we'll try the cheese or jalape√±o brats next time!
Love this!! Most delicious corndog out there!! Follow them on facebook for listing of locations each week. You wont be disappointed
Love it, so worth the wait.  I really love the cheese stick.  The corn is cooked perfect and taste amazing.

These are the worlds best corn dogs (at least for the parts of the world I have visited). They are 
huge and taste great. The cheese sticks are amazing also. Check them out and you will be addicted!
THE best corndogs everrrrr. Be careful, They can be addicting. I'm not usually a fan of corndogs, but these are an exception because they're sooo good.

Huge corn dogs!  It's about a foot long and three inches in diameter in the middle.  The dog tastes like a Polish sausage rather than a regular hotdog.  They remind me of the kind you get at the state/county fairs.  They're currently located on the corner of Durango and Farm/El Capitan across from the Mobil gas station.

Menu
Corndog $5
Puppy(half corndog) $3
Cheesedog $4
Drink $1

Heard about this place from word of mouth. Delicious beefy corndog with a magically killer corn batter on the outside. Very tasty and huge. 

Only downside was that I had no idea where they were located on deer springs and hualapai, my iphone siri couldn't find it. Fyi when you exit 215 in the northwest area, take the hualapai offramp and head north. They are located in a dirt lot. 

Next time i will have to try their cheese on a stick. Service and the owners are superfriendly and have great customer service. If you need corndogs or food to go, they do a great job of packaging it for you in foil and to go containers.
Just stopped for a dog & hot link and it was about 15 minute wait but well worth it ! The batter really is awesome and loved the hot link.  We'll be back for sure.

Damn. I been wanting to try this for a year or more. But I stay so busy. Anyway this gem was parked off centennial which is my neck of the woods. I'd already had dinner but hey... why not .. husband got a cheddar stick and I got a small corn dog. Okay the small is enough for a meal. But I can see people starving get the large. Both items were delish. Fresh, crispy, delishishness. We will track this truck down... my sons gotta try this... and the sauces... amazing.
Excellent, friendly service with the BEST corndogs ever! The Pineapple brat and the cheddar on a stick are also incredible. There is a bit of a wait, but it's worth it for the fresh, delicious food.

Finally tried this place for the first time! I'm so glad they travel to all parts of the valley so we all have a chance to try this gem. I got the puppy(half size) which was bigger than expected and soooooooo delicious! The breading was crispy and not overwhelmingly sweet like some places. I got the fry sauce on the side which was light and not oily or thick at all. My only complaint was the stick gets in the way of sauce dipping. All in all a MUST TRY

I have obsession for food trucks and Worlds Best Corndogs justifies that obsession! They honestly have the best in town! The batter is amazing and they fry them up super crispy! So glad I found them cause they will become a weekly staple for our dinners!! #delish # lovefoodtrucks
Great food, awesome prices & the guys are always super helpful! Love the honey mustard bbq sauce!

These guys are the best. They travel all over the Las Vegas Valley with their delicious corn dogs, brats and cheese sticks. Their homemade sauces are delicious. My favorite is the Cajun.  Thanks guys...
I heard about this on Facebook and omg! Their Corndogs are delicious!  And great price for $6 they are big! Yummy! Definitely recommend this place

I love this truck... So glad it comes once a week next to my house. Even if it wasn't next to my house i would still follow this truck. Its so fresh. The cheesedog is to die for. They have it in cheddar or pepperjack. The hotdog they use is a legit dog. Not no cheap frozen thing from the super market. And if u want something wven more tasty. They have suasage or even a "special" kind each week. I tell all my friends to come here on Tuesdays. The other days he does is kinda far from the Southwest side. But like i said. Worth the drive and wait. Beat $7 corndog in town by FAR.
These corndogs are amazing!! Better than Disneyland!

We visited the spot in Aliante and were super impressed.  The gentleman working are efficient and friendly.  There was quite a crowd but we waited less then 20 minutes for our food.  The regular corn dogs are huge and delicious.  They come out hot and fresh and amazing.  The smaller corn dog is more of a regular size, plenty for a kid.  The cheese sticks were good but not as good as the dogs.  They have a variety of cool sauces to try with the dogs but none that tasted as good as plain old mustard and ketchup.  We will absolutely visit again!

In a side note...there was a cookie truck parked in the same area that night.  I can't remember the name...don't waste your money.  The cookies were expensive and I make better at home.  Even my easy to please obsessed with sweets kids didn't like their cookies.  At $5 each, it was a waste of money.  Sorry cookie truck.

Why why why why why!

More on this later.

Went to the food truck festival in Sunset Park yesterday and I knew I wanted to try this place first...but I wasnt that hungry so I thought I would get the pepper jack cheese dog first, its basically a corn dog breading with cheese inside and its AMAZING.

The corndogs are HUGE but I didnt get one as I was not that hungry yet and I had also promised a friend who was there, a Vegan, that I would try a Veggie burger and thats the why why why part.

I waited all day and went to get a Veggie burger and they were OUT!

My friend was ready to go and so we didnt go back into the park so I could get a corn dog either!

but....

I plan to hunt them down no matter where they are and get a corn dog SOON and another cheese dog--I loved them that much!

Heard through the FB grapevine that the WBC food truck would be nearby, so we headed on over in hot pursuit.  For this date, the truck was parked on a vacant lot in the desert, near Centennial HS.  Apparently, WBC has a nice following because it was steadily busy the hour or so we were there, with people coming and going.  After a short wait, we ordered two corndogs, one cheese stick (which looked like a corndog), a couple of cold drinks, and the Cajun dipping sauce because they didn't have any Thai peanut curry sauce.  Mustard, ketchup, pickles and jalapenos were also available.  Service was pleasant at ordering and pickup points and they seemed to be cranking orders out as fast as they could.

Hubby knows a good corndog when he tries one (after all, he's been to the renowned Minnesota State Fair, home to anything deep fried) and he was very happily impressed--so was I. The cornmeal batter created a light crunchy outside, which complimented the slightly sweet breading on the good-sized hot dogs and cheese stick. I usually like a mustard sauce, but once I tried the spiced Cajun sauce on the dog and cheese, I was hooked!

It was a bit dusty, so we ate in the car, people watching and admiring the sunset. We had some dessert, too, as The Candy Bar food truck was also present.  It was a good overall experience for us and we've decided to pencil them in on our calendar every now and then for a mid-week foodie adventure.

I'm not really a big fan of corn dogs but these were really good!

Price is a little up there but the portions totally make up for that! The regular sized corn dog is HUGE & even the 'puppy' which is supposed to be half the size is big! 

My husband got the hot link & was very satisfied... I've never seen that man eat a corn dog lol. 

I got a puppy corn dog & shared a cheese stick with my son. Both were delicious!

Yesterday was my third time going to the truck, I have tried the corn dog, the cheese stick and the hot link, and they are all AMAZING!!!! Very Delicious!!! Perfect amount of batter every time!! Always hot! Well worth any short or long wait!!! I will be waiting for it to be Wednesday again for another round! :))

I finally found this truck !! So very worth it! The corn dog was huge !!! They have honey mustard and some other sauce .,. They also have hot links. Amazing!!! You have to go to the page on Facebook for the times

There are only two things that makes up an awesome corn dog and that is great dogs and yummy batter and these corn dogs has both. 

Holy Moly am I one happy customer. I've been wanting to try The Worlds Best Corn Dogs LV aka the (Happy Truck or is it the Love Truck) forever and ever and I finally got the chance because they were in our area. 

I grew up in Fresno Ca and we were blessed with the County Fair and the amazing deep fried goodness and the Corn Dogs there are worth going home to. I've always wanted to go back just for the corn dogs but I now do not have to because the corn dogs here are freaking amazing. 

The dog is huge and juicy and the the batter is done so perfectly. Crispy with the right amount of sweetness, grittiness and crunch. It's really hard to explain but these corn dogs are so mouthwatering you must try it if you can. They also have huge cheese on a stick both Cheddar or Pepper Jack and they are both o so good. The best park it the honey mustard bbq sauce. Believe it or not it's soooooo good when dipping with the corn dog. 

Corn Dogs at $5 and puppy (1/2 size) corn dog at $3 and cheese on a stick $4 and it's all worth it. I really want one now talking about it and I will be on the prowl for another one.

***PRICE UPDATE AS OF 9/25/15 their price for each item have increased by a dollar. But it is worth the extra dollar!***

Hands down the best corndogs I've ever tasted.   Fresh fresh fresh and made with quality ingredients... the key to producing a wonderful food item that is highly addictive!   The owners and staff are exceptional and always have a smile on their faces.   Continued success!

They have a "foot long" corn dog. (We all know that size matters)  They have a "puppy dog" for lighter appetites. Lots of yummy dipping sauces to choose from. Pineapple brat and fried cheese sticks.
Something for everyone and at $6.00 for the large corn dog it's a great deal.

I am not a huge lover of corn dogs....HOWEVER, their dogs are GOOD! Hubby and I stopped by last week per several friends recommendations and was not disappointed. The big corn dog is BIG and the cheese stick with tomato basil (side dipping sauce) is awesome. 

We will frequent again....and again.
So excited. New location on Wednesday night. Centennial and Ann. North of InNOut across the street from 24HrFitness. I'm so happy.

The corn dogs are massive.  If you have a smaller appetite get the puppy which is the size of a regular corn dog.  They also have cheese dogs, brats and hot links.  The corn dog was good not sure world's best.  I like a little more batter.  When I went the batter was pretty thin.  Def just a matter of preference.  I will try again next time I see them around.

These corn dogs are doggone fantastic!

Puns aside, they have truly perfected their batter. I love lots of fluffy, semi-sweet, super crunchy batter (the best part!) and there is no shortage of glorious golden brown batter in their version. The hotdog is also extra beefy and juicy - my mouth just waters imagining it! 

They passed out samples at the Great American Foodie Fest (at the rio) and it was love at first bite! I was sold and ordered a corn dog right away. We were also lucky enough to also try their cheese stick - wow, equally good. There is no shortage of quality, gooey cheese and that batter could seriously make a boot delicious!

They also have a variety of sauces to select from. They offered your classic ketchup and mustard, sriracha mayo which was a little too weak for my heat seeking tastebuds, tomato & basil for the cheese stick, but my absolute favorite was the honey mixed in with mustard - I know! I'm shocked too since I don't even love mustard like that, but the honey sweetened it up nicely and mellowed out the sourness in the mustard. It complimented the corn dog super well! It's almost like drizzling honey on your cornbread - get the idea?

Pricing: 
Corn dog $6
Puppy (half sized) $4
Cheese-stick $5

I'm so glad they are residents of Vegas; I know exactly where to go the next time the corn dog craving kicks in.

I likeeee big "corndogs" and I can not lie
 You other "corndogs lovers" can't deny...........
that WORLDS BEST CORNDOGS is truly the very best! 

Do not be scared off by the $6 per corndogs  price tag!! They are 100% worth every single dollar dollar bill! 

Pro Tip: Don't forget to ask for a stamp card!! 

Pro Tip: Eat your corndogs and cheese dogs at the truck. I found that taking them home makes the breading a bit soft and I like how crunchy they are if you eat them right away!! 

Pro Tip: Try putting honey on your corndogs!! Just trust me and thank me later! 

Pro Tip: One regular size corndogs is more than enough for a grown man. Toss in a Pepper Jack Cheesedog to top it off. 

Pro Tip: You've got to try the Honey and Pineapple Brown Sugar BBQ sauce!! 

My only suggestion is that it would be nice to have one or two pop up tables to sit at will waiting for our orders or to eat at quickly.

It was my first food truck experience. 
How fun is it? To locate the truck and go to that place to get your food? It's like scavenger hunt :D I love it, and am looking forward to try other food trucks too!

Now, unto this one. Where else can a grown up get a corn dog, besides state fair or frozen ones you cook on your own?

And it's not any corndog, it's a darn good corndog! Ginormous too! Their half sized version is called "puppy", and is easily bigger than any corn dogs I've seen.

They have free condiments like picked cucumbers and banana peppers, ketchup and mustard, sriracha mayo (YES!).

Be sure to check out their specials, like brat corndogs and gourmet dipping sauces!!

Cant wait to see them again

I heard about this truck from a foodie review on Facebook. I'm a huge corn dog fan. There location stops are kind of a drive but I'm so happy they are away from the strip traffic, the location schedule is usually routine and it's super easy to find. The dogs are delicious, come out quick and you get a lot of bang for your buck. Plus as someone that loves sauce more than actual food itself you must appreciate the sauce station! Definitely worth busting the mini mission for!

Driving home from work a couple days ago, I noticed a tiny little food truck with the words "Worlds Best Corndogs" plastered across the side of it. Sadly, we had dinner plans that night...but today, oh today, I was going to put those claims to the test, regardless of dinner plans.

Currently parked on the Southwest corner of Durango & Farm, this little yellow food truck has probably the smallest menu you're going to find on any truck. They've got a corndog, a smaller corndog called the Puppy, cheese on a stick, and drinks. That's it. Looking at older pictures, it seems as if they may have had a veggie option at one point, but I didn't see it on my visit. 

Now, while I'm not some type of corndog fanatic or anything, it's surprisingly hard to find a good one. But, there is one version out there that I do absolutely love. If you've ever been to Disneyland, you'll know which one I'm talking about. It's served at the Little Red Wagon and a few other places throughout the park. And in my opinion, it's one of the best corndogs you can find. Unfortunately, here in Las Vegas, there's just about nothing that comes even close...until now.

Much like the ones in Disneyland, these dogs are hand dipped in what appears to be a cornmeal based batter. The batter is laid on evenly thick, it's warm, and not only do you get all kinds of great texture with the crispy exterior and soft interior, but the flavor is great. Combined with an extremely juicy all beef dog, this is one killer snack. It's salty, it's sweet, it's soft, it's crunchy. And if you're like me, a quick dip in mustard makes everything come together perfectly. At only $5 for what looks to be about a foot long dog, it's also not going to break the bank.

The other options on the menu are reasonable priced as well. A Puppy will run you $3, cheese on a stick is $4, and drinks are only $1.

I can't say much for the service as they basically just rung me up, told me to grab my drink out of a cooler and sent me on my way. But I enjoyed my dog, didn't spend too much, and it gave me a little memory of one of my favorite snacks from Disneyland. After overhearing them tell someone else this corner was working well for them, I'm looking forward to being able to go down the street and grab another!

I absolutely love Worlds Best Corndogs! It's the best place to get corndogs. I literally go on their Facebook to track them down for a corn dog. Luckily they come up by my house often, but when they're not near me, it totally worth it to just find them and drive out! Highly recommend!
We'll definitely be back to get some corn dogs and cheese sticks soon. The batter is the perfect compliment to the dog and cheese. Nice and cornmeal grainy. Love love loved it!!!!

Yum! There's not much to say-these corn dogs were good! We got a puppy size for our nephews and regular corn dogs for 4 adults. I wasn't able to finish mine and had to give it to my husband. My 3 year old nephew loved it and probably could have finished a regular corn dog. They have a few sauce choices, and we went with honey mustard. It was pretty good, but I pretty much just stuck with regular ketchup and mustard. We'll definitely be back-our nephew was a huge fan!

If only I could double triple or even quadruple my stars I would! It's all about the batter and the oil, and of course the quality of the dog! Oh and then the sauce... Umm mm mm. These guys have it perfected! All of it! Perfect texture and amount of delicious corn bready, cakey, doughy, goodness that surrounds a superior quality dog of ginormous juicy snap and flavor! The honey mustard dipping sauce... Ridiculous! Yum! 
I actually had to laugh at myself for how much I enjoyed this corn dog. There's no going back now! The bar has been set. The name says it all, and I agree 100%!!! Bravo you guys!!! I can now honestly say that I have had the best corn dog that I have ever had in my life!!!!..... And I am pretty picky, just ask my fam. I'm not easy to please. Cudo's Worlds Best.... Much respect! 
Oh, I should mention my inaugural visit was at shadow ridge HS location August 25, 2016. And such a friendly experience from the guys on the truck... I just can't say enough good things about this experience. Just thank you!

What a great simple menu of corndogs cheese sticks and soda! Doesn't get much better on a cool night in Vegas. They have two sizes of corn dogs hotlinks and cheese sticks.  The batter was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside with a nice cornmeal flavor. Only suggestion would be to add maybe one table and a couple chairs but other than that what a fun great night.

GO BIG OR GO HOME. 

I trekked all the way out to the middle of nowhere just to try a World's Best Corndog. Was it worth it? YES.

For a meal on its own, order the regular corndog for $6.00. It's a foot long, quality hot dog encased in crunchy, deep fried batter. Standard condiments such as mustard and ketchup are available, but there are also a variety of bottled sauces -- the honey mustard bbq was the way to go.

If you're not into corndogs or want to eat somewhat "light," there are other options on the menu. The "Puppy" is a smaller corndog that's roughly half the size of a regular. Also offered are battered and fried cheese sticks -- your choice of either cheddar or pepper jack. Remember to ask the staff about specials of the evening. 

The truck makes appearances on both the southwest and northwest parts of town weekly during the evenings. But remember to stalk them on social media for their most updated schedule.

I think I just had high expectations because of the name of the food truck, the reviews and pictures. I just felt I had to tried them. I don't mind the price if it is that good it's gonna worth it "right"? Well..... I got mine yesterday on Blue Diamond and Durango. Okay this is my opinion I just didn't get the fuzz they are oily as Fu@! The batter didn't have that crispness a corndog should have and the taste of it just didn't hit the spot to follow them or try again. 3 stars for costumer service for sure, they were really nice and explained colors on stick to know what kind Corndog they were.

I've seen these "World's Best Corndogs" trucks in other states. They are all run by different people (the best one I've had is in St. George, UT) yet have the same concept.  You can find this Vegas based truck around different parts of town and they keep their weekly schedule updated on social media (I find it on their Facebook page) regularly. The line can get long, but it's worth it for one of these fried delights. 

Corndog ($6) - made to order, the batter has a nice taste and the corndog is a decent size. I do wish for the price that it came with a can of soda like some of the World's Best Corndogs trucks in other states offer, but whatever. They have ketchup and mustard self-serve style so you can dress or dip your corndog to your liking. Don't forget to ask for a punch card because after 10 punches you get a free corndog. 

If you don't want a big corndog you could order a "puppy" which is half the size for $4. Cheese Sticks are $5 and they also offer a Hot Link and Pineapple Brat for $7. Drinks are a buck.

Really great corn dogs!  Probably the best I've had in a long time!  I like how they offer two different sizes just in case you're extra hungry. I recommend trying the cheese sticks too. Usually available in both cheddar and pepper jack. There's also a pineapple brat that I haven't tried yet, but sounds really good. Maybe next time. Can't wait to go get some soon!!!!
Oh my goodness we had the Corn dog and the cheese stick. They were both so delicious. I will be back once a week a must try.
The Best Corn Dogs in the World!!!! Gotta try and catch the corndog truck Wednesdays on Centennial!!!
Staff is relatively friendly.  Corn dogs are definitely not the best in the world, maybe best of the West coast.   Worth trying.

Holy Corndogs.... 

I've spotted this truck in our NW neighborhood of Providence this Wednesday on my drive home from work. They seem to have a following with a ton of cars pulled off (there were 3 food trucks this evening on the same corner) and opted to pop by and see what the Yelp was all about. 

I ordered....

1 Corn dog (it was Gigantic) for $5.00
1 Cheese Stick for $4.00

Note: There wasn't any seating during my visit. Plan to stand and eat or take it and run (like I did).  They do accept plastic (which is always a plus in my book). 


I love cheese and dove head first into the cheese stick. I gobbled that sucker down before I took a picture (no regrets). It was spectacular! The batter was great. It was very crisp and crunchy on the outside with sweet cornbread batter on the inside with overflowing gooey Pepper Jack cheese (I believe the other option was Cheddar). I would compare it to a cornbread grilled cheese on a stick. I took a bite and the cheese was perfectly melted with a great ratio of cheese to cornbread. LOVE. 

Now, I was stuffed after my cheese indulgence. I only took a few bites of my corn dog and have the rest in my fridge. The bites I did take were great. The cornbread was just as good as my cheese stick and the hotdog center was tasty. I was taking my items to go and didn't hit up the sauce table for dips (nor did I ask if they offer dips in containers to go-- shucks). I wish I would've checked that table out. 

Final Verdict: 
It's worth the stop. Buy yourself and your family a corn dog meal (or yummy cheese stick) and live a little. Check their social media handles to see if they will be in a neighborhood near you.

This place serves epic corn dogs. Be there five minutes or more before the opening time to avoid a wait. The corn dogs are giant. The coating is the right thickness and the crunch is perfect, sweet yet not too sweet. The sausage has the right balance, I thought almost a smoky note. We got the kids the smaller version of the corn dog and they loved them as well. We got the cheddar and pepper jack cheese sticks, which are breaded in the corn dog mix and fried- those are money!  They food truck also offers a revolving special. This time it was a hot link corn dog. My husband loved it. I'd certainly eat there again. They take cards.
It's big.  Worth the money. Had it at the Foodie Fest today.  Corn dogs are corn dogs.  It tasted fresh the batter was good. Was it the best??? Pretty darn close
This place is awesome. I stop every chance I see it on the corner is Durango and blue diamond. It takes just like a corn dog from the county fair. Delish!

A MUST TRY! Best corndogs and cheese sticks that I've ever had! You think hot dog on a stick is good, THINK AGAIN! Tried the corndog, pepper jack and cheddar cheese stick and loved it! Follow them on Facebook or Instagram to see where they will be:) they also take credit cards! In case you don't have cash on you! Your belly will love you forever once you try them out!!

Tried the pineapple brat and their pepper jack cheese stick.  The brat was huge and very good.  The cheese stick matched up best with their basil tomato sauce.  Definitely worth trying.  Breaking is great, all around one of the best corn dogs I've had.
Seriously the best corndogs in the world ( hence the name ) Even if you don't like corndogs, you will love these. They taste gourmet and fresh and are huge! I want one now just writing this review!

I'm a big fan of this food truck. They park outside of Pop Drinks (Tropicana & Fort Apache) every Wednesday night so I get my favorite drink along with my meal.

I always get Cheese Sticks-- cheddar is my favorite but pepper jack is delicious too. I don't eat meat so it makes me really happy that they have vegetarian options! My boyfriend is in love with The Corndog. The batter is really delicious, especially dipped in mustard!

I definitely recommend grabbing a bite from this food truck-- especially when they're out side of Pop Drinks because it's the perfect combo! Check them out on Instagram @worldsbestcorndogslv for updates and location information.

For being so overpriced I was not impressed. The batter is not seasoned at all! They weren't very friendly either which is surprising for a small business. Won't be returning. 

But also, its such a pain to catch their truck on the only night they go to your side of town.

The best Corndogs we've ever had. Look forward to eating them every week!!!

Please don't ever leave Vegas lol
I haven't had many corn dogs in my life but these were delicious.  We tried pretty much everything and I loved the hotlink corndog, it was spicy and very good.

I am such a fan!! The dogs and cheeses are made fresh to order and well worth any waiting. The specials are always super tasty to try and I love the array of sauces available. I try to eat at this truck weekly as it is usually by my house! Such an awesome and fun treat!

Hubby gave these a 5 out 5 says they are great corndogs a little pricey for my taste. 6.00 bucks for the large size and 4.00 for the "puppy" a regular size corn dog. Overall a fun date on a Friday night walk around the park afterward. Today they were at Aviary Park in North Las Vegas.
Amazingly good and phenomenal customer service.   It takes a little bit to get food after ordering, but it is so worth the wait.  I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THEM!
This is one of the best corndogs that I have ever had. I love the fried cheese too and the people are so nice.
These are seriously good. Not your generic corn dogs, these are the real deal. The kids loved them too. Would definitely stop by this truck again.

So the question is...IS IT THE WORLD'S BEST CORNDOG??? 

I don't know, because I haven't travelled the world and ordered a CORNDOG at each country. But, I think this is as good as it will get. Should it possibly be re-named, "world's BIGGEST CORNDOG?"

Most corndogs I've eaten are from frozen food. And most likely the sausage quality is terrible inside. The only other stuff is at amusement parks, which I assume are frozen. Then there's hotdog on a stick. Good stuff but it is mighty pequeno next to the WORLDS BEST CORNDOG.

Great corn bread batter on the outside, GINORMOUS that you'd probably want to share one with another person, and they have awesome specials at times where they use a different sausage inside. 

I ABSOLUTELY LOVED the spicy sausage corn dog that was on special for the day. Never had that before so it was a nice contrast between the spicy sausage link and the sweet batter. The regular CORNDOG is amazing as well. And what topped it off for me to make this the BEST I've had is their CAJUN SAUCE. WOW. THAT IS GOOD STUFF. It's rich, not watered-down, got great flavor, and it goes SO well with the CORNDOG. 

I tried the pineapple bratwurst as well, but preferred the other two. Just a warning, the regular corndogs are gigantic!!!!!!!!!!!

I got the regular corndog and pineapple corn dog. I usually eat the crust before I eat the dog. The crust at this place is better than hot dog and a stick. The crust here is thicker than usual but super moist and crispy. 

I wanted to try their special corn dog so i went for the pineapple. They recommend you use the pineapple suace with it but I thoight it tasted fine without any sauce. The  meat was super tender and juicy. The brat does have pineapple chunks in there which made it a lot better. 

Check their FB for their location.

Had the chance of experiencing these corn dogs for the first time last night with my family.  After having the corn dogs and the hot link I am addicted.  These are the best corn dogs/ hot link I have ever had.  I will be returning as often as possible for these delicious, mouth watering corn dogs!  Love it!
Best corn dog I've ever had. Brings out the kid in me. From the huge size of the corn dogs to the great selection of dipping sauces, there's something for everyone.

This is my favorite food truck!! The corndogs are delicious and the customer service is phenomenal. They have the best corndogs that I have ever had. I highly recommend them!! Special shout out to Cody!!
Best Corn Dog I've ever had! Tried em at the Foodie Fest and been following the whereabouts online ever since.
Worlds Best Corndogs rocks! These corn dogs and cheese dogs are the bomb. We try to frequent them often. Definitely worth the visit.

This place is great! The corn dogs are pretty good, but the cheese is amazing! Give this place a try and you will not be disappointed. It would be nice if we knew where they were going to be everyday. Now I just have to stop when I see them.

When you can find this food truck in your area, GET THERE!!! We wanted to try these for the longest time and thankfully started following them on Instagram so we would know when he was on Blue Diamond and Durango.  The dogs are HUGE and the secret sauces (you have to ask for them when you order) are awesome and I guess change all the time.  We waited for the dogs while we were in the car and hung out there to eat them.  The cornbread is super good and I have no idea how they make them so crispy yet not at all dry inside with a great tasting dog.  These are the best we have had in a long time and our 2 1/2 year old almost ate a normal size one herself she loved it so much!  Definitely finding this truck again and making these a routine anytime he is in our hood!!
The corndogs here are to die for. The people are great and the service is impeccable! it's a must try!!

No exaggeration - the best corndog and cheese stick I've had! I'd definitely recommend! Great prices, they post their locations on facebook and not to mention the great customer service! I know it sounds weird but i tried honey on my corndog and it was so good! The pepperjack cheese stick is out of this world! So happy they finally came to my side of town! Misha

This truck was set up at Mountain's Edge Annual Fido Fest. 
I have to say it was the best corndog I ever had, it wasn't greasy, the corn bread was nice and crisp on the outside and moist on the inside. The hotdog was just as good, cooked all the way through and stayed nice and juicy. Plus it was gigantic, for 5$, great price IMO. Staff was friendly. The dogs were made fresh but the wait wasn't too long even with the constant line of people ordering corndogs.
If you're a fan of corndogs, i say give them a try!

Wow!! Just wow!!! The tastiest and biggest corndogs ever. My expectations were highly exceeded! These are a must try. Been telling my friends and family about it all week! Couldn't wait for Wednesday to roll back around!!

I can't explain what it was I didn't like about the flavor of the corn dogs, but they were just okay. Not my favorite, but I've had worse and better. The people who run this truck were very friendly though.

I LOVE Disneyland corndogs and these are pretty darn close to the ones there!  We went on Valentine's Day...lol...I'm a cheap date (also we are parents now...ha!).  These corndogs have a nice crispy exterior and fluffy corndog batter.  We got two regular size corndogs, a pepperjack cheese corn stick, and a hot link corndog.  The corndogs and hotlinks are on point with flavor.  You can eat them alone....but we also got the pineapple brown sugar ketchup.  The ketchup is delicious....sweet and tangy with just a hint of spice.  Was not a big fan of the cheese stick, there was just too much batter.  The ones with hot dogs/links/brats have a better meat to bread ratio.  Make sure to check your order before you drive off....they short changed me by one corn dog.  Given they were pretty busy that night, I'll give them a pass.  I went back and they gave me my other corn dog right away.  I know other trucks sometimes set up some tables or places for people to sit.  This place has no seating, so BYOC or sit in your car.  Probably better in the spring time when the weather is better and there's more daylight.  When we went it was a little chilly and pitch black out.  Definitely worth a try if your in the area.

This by far is one of the most delicious corn dogs I have had in a long time. The size of the corn dog was just right for the price it was. The batter was quite taste but not over whelming like other places. I look forward to when they pass by my side of town again.
Awesome corn dogs!!! 9inches of glorious corn dog! Been waiting for them to come back to mountain crest park and I was pleasantly surprised to see them today! Thank you!

Me and my husband love corndogs.  After seeing them on Facebook, we drove out to Providence and gave them a try.  It was $6 for a large corndog.  Cheaper than the corndogs we love at Disneyland.  We actually thought it was better than the ones we always look forward to at Disneyland actually.  These were not greasy.  They had many different sauces you can put on your corndog.  My husband enjoyed the Sriracha mayonnaise and I liked the good old fashioned mustard.  If you love corndogs you have to check out this truck!!!!

Worlds Best Corndog....maybe not. Worlds Biggest Corndog...I think so! This thing is HUGE!

I saw they would be semi-close by my house so I decided to get lunch here. I do love corndogs, especially the ones found at State Fairs. This corndog did blow them away because the batter is really good with great corn flavor. Could have been a little sweeter but that's what honey and mustard add. For $5, this is like eating two regular corndogs, and I was full when I finished. I didn't try a cheese stick so can't comment, but I will agree with others that the batter and hot dog are high quality and must be tried.

Check out their website for locations as they move around the city but generally can be found in Centennial area. Nice people, good food, fair prices. Post photos of you trying to stuff this thing in your mouth!

These corndogs are awesome, just may be the World's Best! You know the best part about this outfit? Unlike other venders that jack up their prices at festivals and fairs, these folks keep their prices the same. Thank you guys! We'll keep supporting as long as you keep the same quality for a decent price. Appreciate the efficiency and good service too!

World's best corndog? I don't know about that but these are some pretty delicious doggies.

We ordered the pineapple brat corndog to share and it was delicious. I was worried the batter wouldn't work well with the texture and flavor of the sausage, but I was wrong. The batter was a little grainy but was tasty. 

I won't go out of my way to find this food truck again but it's a solid choice when you come across them out on the road.

I usually give a place a couple of tries before reviewing them, but 1) i am not a big fan of corndogs and 2) this is a food truck and the likelihood that I will see it again is very slim. 

So I sampled a couple of their dogs at an Easter Egg Hunt event and needless to say, I wasn't too enthused with the food. It was ok but just not my cup of tea if you know what I mean. I got the cheese dog and the kid corn dog. The kid corn dog was the same size as the regular corn dog and the cheese stick was just cheese covered in the cornbread shell. There was more covering than meat and so the oil saturated in the bread casing was very overwhelming for me since I don't eat a lot of fried food like this. 

So while the corn dogs weren't bad, they just weren't enough to persuade me to get them again.
